<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<!--NSI Web Service v8.19.7.0-->
<message:Structure xmlns:message="http://www.sdmx.org/resources/sdmxml/schemas/v2_1/message" xmlns:structure="http://www.sdmx.org/resources/sdmxml/schemas/v2_1/structure" xmlns:common="http://www.sdmx.org/resources/sdmxml/schemas/v2_1/common">
  <message:Header>
    <message:ID>IDREF12918</message:ID>
    <message:Test>false</message:Test>
    <message:Prepared>2025-08-19T16:37:34.6950138+02:00</message:Prepared>
    <message:Sender id="Unknown" />
    <message:Receiver id="Unknown" />
  </message:Header>
  <message:Structures>
    <structure:Dataflows>
      <structure:Dataflow id="DSD_GHG_PLC_P@DF_GHG_PLC_P" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" version="1.0" isFinal="true">
        <common:Annotations>
          <common:Annotation>
            <common:AnnotationType>NonProductionDataflow</common:AnnotationType>
            <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">true</common:AnnotationText>
          </common:Annotation>
          <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
            <common:AnnotationTitle>TIME_PERIOD</common:AnnotationTitle>
            <common:AnnotationType>LAYOUT_ROW</common:AnnotationType>
          </common:Annotation>
          <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
            <common:AnnotationTitle>PLASTIC_LIFEC_S,SCENARIO,GHG</common:AnnotationTitle>
            <common:AnnotationType>LAYOUT_COLUMN</common:AnnotationType>
          </common:Annotation>
          <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
            <common:AnnotationTitle>OBS_STATUS=A,FREQ=A,DECIMALS=2</common:AnnotationTitle>
            <common:AnnotationType>NOT_DISPLAYED</common:AnnotationType>
          </common:Annotation>
          <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
            <common:AnnotationTitle>TIME_PERIOD_START=2019</common:AnnotationTitle>
            <common:AnnotationType>DEFAULT</common:AnnotationType>
          </common:Annotation>
          <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
            <common:AnnotationTitle>REF_AREA:OECD.ENV.EEI:HCL_LOCATION(1.0).H</common:AnnotationTitle>
            <common:AnnotationType>HIER_CONTEXT</common:AnnotationType>
          </common:Annotation>
        </common:Annotations>
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Projections of Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Plastic Lifecycle</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Projections des émissions de gaz à effet de serre de l’ensemble du cycle de vie des plastiques</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en"><p>The dataset displays projections of greenhouse gas emissions from primary plastics, in million tonnes of CO2 equivalent (t CO2 eq). The dataset provides estimates at the global level under different scenarios. Details can be found in the Annex of the OECD Global Plastics Outlook: Policy Scenarios to 2060. The time horizon of the projections is 2060.</p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><em>Aggregation &amp; consolidation:</em></span> Greenhouse gases emissions are aggregated using 100-year global warming potential (GWP) from AR2 (IPCC, 1995).&nbsp;</p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><em>Other manipulations:</em></span> Emission coefficients by stage and polymer or end-of-life fate are extrapolated from 2015 data using indexes. These indexes are built on scope-2 emissions intensity of primary and secondary plastics production (incl. upstream sectors) from the OECD ENV-Linkages model.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Contact:</strong>&nbsp;<a href="mailto:env.linkages@oecd.org">env.linkages@oecd.org</a></p>
<p><strong>Data source(s) used:</strong> <a href="https://doi.org/10.1787/aa1edf33-en">OECD Global Plastics Outlook: Policy Scenarios to 2060</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oecd.org/content/oecd/en/topics/sub-issues/environment-economy-modelling-and-outlooks.html">OECD ENV-Linkages model</a>, <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41558-019-0459-z">Zheng and Suh (2019)</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p></common:Description>
        <common:Description xml:lang="fr"><p>La base de donn&eacute;es affiche les projections des &eacute;missions de gaz &agrave; effet de serre provenant des plastiques primaires, en millions de tonnes d'&eacute;quivalent CO2 (t CO2 eq). La base de donn&eacute;es fournit des&nbsp;estimations au niveau mondial pour diff&eacute;rents sc&eacute;narios d&eacute;taill&eacute;s dans l'Annexe des Perspectives Mondiales des Plastiques de l'OCDE: Sc&eacute;narios d&rsquo;action &agrave; l&rsquo;horizon 2060.</p>
<p><em>Agr&eacute;gation et consolidation :</em> Les &eacute;missions de gaz &agrave; effet de serre sont agr&eacute;g&eacute;es en utilisant le potentiel de r&eacute;chauffement global sur 100 ans (PRG) de l'AR2 (GIEC, 1995).</p>
<p><em>Autres manipulations :</em> Les coefficients d'&eacute;mission par &eacute;tape et par polym&egrave;re ou destin&eacute;e en fin de vie sont extrapol&eacute;s &agrave; partir des donn&eacute;es de 2015 en utilisant des indices. Ces indices sont bas&eacute;s sur l'intensit&eacute; des &eacute;missions de scope 2 de la production de plastiques primaires et secondaires (y compris les secteurs amont) du mod&egrave;le ENV-Linkages de l'OCDE.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Contact : </strong> <a>env.linkages@oecd.org</a></p>
<p><strong>Sources utilis&eacute;es : <a href="https://doi.org/10.1787/aa1edf33-en">OECD Global Plastics Outlook: Policy Scenarios to 2060</a>,</strong> <a href="https://www.oecd.org/content/oecd/fr/topics/sub-issues/environment-economy-modelling-and-outlooks.html">OECD ENV-Linkages model</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41558-019-0459-z">Zheng and Suh (2019)</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p></common:Description>
        <structure:Structure>
          <Ref id="DSD_GHG_PLC_P" version="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="datastructure" class="DataStructure" />
        </structure:Structure>
      </structure:Dataflow>
    </structure:Dataflows>

      </structure:CategoryScheme>

    <structure:Categorisations>
      <structure:Categorisation id="CAT_OECD_ENV_EEI__DSD_GHG_PLC_P@DF_GHG_PLC_P__1_0@OECD__OECDCS1__5_0__ENV_ENV_PLS" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" version="1.0" isFinal="false">

        <common:Description xml:lang="en">Measure</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="GHG_PROJECTION">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Projections des émissions de gaz à effet de serre de l’ensemble du cycle de vie des plastiques par scénario</common:Name>

      <structure:Codelist isPartial="true" id="CL_SCENARIO" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" version="1.0" isFinal="true">

      <structure:Codelist id="CL_DECIMALS" agencyID="SDMX" version="1.0" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Decimals</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides a list of values showing the number of decimal digits used in the data. This code list was released in 2009. More information about this code list and SDMX code lists in general (e.g. list of generic codes for expressing general concepts like "Total", "Unknown", etc.; syntaxes for the creation of further codes; general guidelines for the creation of SDMX code lists) can be found at this address: https://sdmx.org/?page_id=4345.</common:Description>

        </structure:Code>

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">One</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Two</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Three</common:Name>

        </structure:Code>

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Seven</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Eight</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>

        <structure:Code id="11">

        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="12">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Twelve</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="13">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Thirteen</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="14">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Fourteen</common:Name>

      <structure:Codelist id="CL_FREQ" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.1" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Code list for concept "Frequency"</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Codelist pour le concept "Fréquence"</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides a set of values indicating
					the "frequency" of the data (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly). The concept
					"frequency" may refer to various stages in the production process, e.g. data
					collection or data dissemination. For example, a time series could be
					disseminated at annual frequency but the underlying data are compiled monthly.
					The code list is applicable for all different uses of
					"frequency".</common:Description>
        <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Cette liste de codes fournit un ensemble de valeurs
					indiquant la "fréquence" des données (par exemple, hebdomadaire, mensuelle,
					trimestrielle). Le concept de "fréquence" peut faire référence à différentes
					étapes du processus de production, par ex. collecte ou diffusion de données. Par
					exemple, une série chronologique pourrait être diffusée à une fréquence
					annuelle, mais les données sous-jacentes sont compilées mensuellement. La liste
					de codes est applicable pour toutes les différentes utilisations de
					"fréquence".</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Annual</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Annuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Biennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Biennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Triennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Triennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every three years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A4">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quadrennial</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Quadriennale</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every four years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A5">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Quinquennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quinquennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every five years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A10">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Décennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Decennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every ten years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A20">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bidécennal</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Bidecennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every twenty years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A30">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Tridécennal</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tridecennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every thirty years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A_3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Three times a year</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trois fois par an</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						three times a year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Half-yearly, semester</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Semestrielle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every semester</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quarterly</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trimestrielle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every quarter</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Mensuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Monthly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bimestrielle</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Bimonthly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two months</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M_2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Semi-mensuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Semimonthly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						twice a month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M_3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Three times a month</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trois fois par mois</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						three times a month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Hebdomadaire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Weekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Aux 2 semaines</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Biweekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two weeks</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Aux 3 semaines</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Triweekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every three weeks</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W4">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Aux 4 semaines</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Four-weekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every four weeks</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W_2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bihebdomadaire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Semiweekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						twice a week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W_3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Three times a week</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trois fois par semaine</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						three times a week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Daily</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Quotidienne</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every day</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D_2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Deux fois par jour</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Twice a day</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						twice a day</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Horaire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hourly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every hour</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bihoraire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Bihourly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two hours</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trihoraire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Trihourly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every three hours</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="B">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Daily – business week</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Jours ouvrable</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Similar to "daily", however there are no
						observations for Saturdays and Sundays (so, neither “missing values” nor
						“numeric values” should be provided for Saturday and
						Sunday)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Chaque minute</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Minutely</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">While N denotes "minutely", usually, there may be
						no observations every minute (for several series the frequency is usually
						"irregular" within a day/days). And though observations may be sparse (not
						collected or disseminated every minute), missing values do not need to be
						given for the minutes when no observations exist: in any case the time stamp
						determines when an observation is observed</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Irregular</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Irrégulière</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used with irregular time series that stores
						data for a sequence of arbitrary timepoints. Irregular time series are
						appropriate when the data arrives unpredictably, such as when the
						application records every stock trade or when random events are recorded
						(the interval between each element can be a different
						length)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="OA">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Occasional annual</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Occasionnelle annuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">The event occurs occasionally with an infrequent
						update that could span from 1 year to several years between events. It
						implies a survey that experiences a gap for several years prior to the next
						survey update (this is commonly linked to funding available to run a
						specific survey (i.e. health surveys), whereas a regular annual survey
						refers typically to ‘programs’ that are funded regularly and fall under the
						Statistics Act, and therefore never experience a gap)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="OM">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Occasional monthly</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Occasionnelle mensuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">The event occurs occasionally with an infrequent
						update that could span from 1 month to several months between events. It
						implies a survey that experiences a gap for several months prior to the next
						survey update</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="_O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Autre</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Other</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used when the qualitative or quantitative
						values that a variable takes in a data set is associated to multiple
						occurrences with frequency other than the already defined ones (for example
						every 5 hours and 32 minutes etc.)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="_U">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Non spécifié</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unspecified</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used when a set of values are reported
						within a time range but not associated to sub ranges. Often this could
						happen in case of missing or sparse information. (Let’s say we have two
						observations for 2020 but we do not know if they are part of a monthly
						reporting or quarterly reporting)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="_Z">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">N'est pas applicable</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not applicable</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used when the qualitative or quantitative
						values that a variable takes in a data set is not associated to multiple
						occurrences (only single occurrence exists) one can use the _Z as
						frequency</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist id="CL_OBS_STATUS" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.2" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation Status</common:Name>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Normal value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used as default value if no value is provided or when no special coded qualification is assumed. Usually, it can be assumed that the source agency assigns sufficient confidence to the provided observation and/or the value is not expected to be dramatically revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="B">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time series break</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observations are characterised as such when different content exists or a different methodology has been applied to this observation as compared with the preceding one (the one given for the previous period).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Definition differs</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate slight deviations from the established methodology (footnote-type information); these divergences do not imply a break in time series.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="E">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Estimated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation obtained through an estimation methodology (e.g. to produce back-casts) or based on the use of a limited amount of data or ad hoc sampling and through additional calculations (e.g. to produce a value at an early stage of the production stage while not all data are available). It may also be used in case of experimental data (e.g. in the context of a pilot ahead of a full scale production process) or in case of data of (anticipated/assessed) low quality. If needed, additional information can be provided through free text using the COMMENT_OBS attribute at the observation level or at a higher level. This code is to be used when the estimation is done by a sender agency. When the imputation is carried out by a receiver agency in order to replace or fill gaps in reported data series, the flag to use is I "Value imputed by a receiving agency".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="F">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Forecast value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value deemed to assess the magnitude which a quantity will assume at some future point of time (as distinct from "estimated value" which attempts to assess the magnitude of an already existent quantity).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="G">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Experimental value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Data collected on the basis of definitions or (alternative) collection methods under development. Data not of guaranteed quality as normally expected from provider.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Value imputed by a receiving agency</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation imputed by a receiving agency to replace or fill gaps in reported data series. This code is intended to cover all cases where a receiving agency publishes data about a sending agency that do not come from an official source in the sender agency's reporting framework. When the estimation is done by the sender agency, the flag to use is E "Estimated value".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="K">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Data included in another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data for a given category are missing and are included in another category, sub-total or total. Generally where code "K" is used there should be a corresponding code "W - Includes data from another category" assigned to the over-covered category. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify under which category the data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Includes data from another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data include another category, or go beyond the scope of the data collection and are therefore over-covered. Generally, where code "W" is used there should be a corresponding code "K - Data included in another category" assigned to the category which is under-covered. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify which additional data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is to be used when no breakdown is made between the reasons why data are missing. Data can be missing due to many reasons: data cannot exist, data exist but are not collected (e.g. because they are below a certain threshold or subject to a derogation clause), data are unreliable, etc.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data cannot exist</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to denote empty cells resulting from the impossibility to collect a statistical value (e.g. a particular education level or type of institution may be not applicable to a given country's education system).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Provisional value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">An observation is characterised as "provisional" when the source agency - while it bases its calculations on its standard production methodology - considers that the data, almost certainly, are expected to be revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Strike and other special events</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Special circumstances (e.g. strike) affecting the observation or causing a missing value.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="L">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data exist but were not collected</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when some data are not reported/disseminated because they are below a certain threshold.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; holiday or weekend</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used in some daily data flows.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; suppressed</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when data are suppressed due to statistical confidentiality considerations.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="J">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Derogation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Clause in an agreement (e.g. legal act, gentlemen's agreement) stating that some provisions in the agreement are not to be implemented by designated parties; these derogations may affect the observation or cause a missing value. In general, derogations are limited in time.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not significant</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate a value which is not a "real" zero (e.g. a result of 0.0004 rounded to zero).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="U">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Low reliability</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This indicates existing observations, but for which the user should also be aware of the low quality assigned.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="V">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unvalidated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation as received from the respondent without further evaluation of data quality.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist id="CL_UNIT_MULT" agencyID="SDMX" version="1.1" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit Multiplier</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides code values for indicating the magnitude in the units of measurement. More information about this code list and SDMX code lists in general (e.g. list of generic codes for expressing general concepts like "Total", "Unknown", etc.;
          syntaxes for the creation of further codes; general guidelines for the creation of SDMX code lists) can be found at this address: https://sdmx.org/?page_id=4345.</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="0">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Units</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of zero (10^0)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="1">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tens</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of one (10^1)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundreds</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of two (10^2)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Thousands</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of three (10^3)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="4">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tens of thousands</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of four (10^4)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="5">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundreds of thousands</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of five(10^5)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="6">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Millions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of six (10^6)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="7">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tens of millions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of seven (10^7)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="8">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundreds of millions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of eight (10^8)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="9">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Billions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of nine (10^9)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="10">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tens of billions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of ten (10^10)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="11">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundreds of billions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of eleven (10^11)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="12">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Trillions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of twelve (10^12)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="13">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tens of trillions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of thirteen (10^13)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="14">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundreds of trillions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of fourteen (10^14)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="15">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quadrillions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of fifteen (10^15)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-1">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tenths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus one (10^-1)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundredths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus two (10^-2)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Thousandths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus three (10^-3)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-4">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Ten-thousandths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus four (10^-4)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-5">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundred-thousandths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus five (10^-5)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-6">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Millionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus six (10^-6)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-7">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Ten-millionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus seven (10^-7)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-8">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundred-millionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus eight (10^-8)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-9">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Billionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus nine (10^-9)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-10">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Ten-billionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus ten (10^-10)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-11">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundred-billionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus eleven (10^-11)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-12">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Trillionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus twelve (10^-12)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-13">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Ten-trillionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus thirteen (10^-13)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-14">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hundred-trillionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus fourteen (10^-14)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="-15">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quadrillionths</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of minus fifteen (10^-15)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
    </structure:Codelists>
    <structure:Concepts>
      <structure:ConceptScheme isPartial="true" id="CS_GPO" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" version="1.0" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">GPO Concept Scheme</common:Name>
        <structure:Concept id="FREQ">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Frequency of observation</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Fréquence d'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Time interval at which observations occur over a given time period.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="TIME_PERIOD">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time period</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Temps</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Timespan or point in time to which the observation actually refers.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="MEASURE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Measure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Mesure</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Measure</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="OBS_VALUE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation value</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Valeur de l'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value of a particular variable.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="OBS_STATUS">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation status</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Statut de l'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Information on the quality of a value or an unusual or missing value.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="UNIT_MULT">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit multiplier</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Multiplicateur d'unité</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Exponent in base 10 specified so that multiplying the observation numeric values by 10^UNIT_MULT gives a value expressed in the unit of measure.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="UNIT_MEASURE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit of measure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Unité de mesure</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Unit in which the data values are expressed.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="POLLUTANT">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Greenhouse gas</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Gaz à effet de serre</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Greenhouse gas</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="PLASTIC_LIFEC_S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Plastic lifecycle stage</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Cycle de vie des plastiques</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Plastic lifecycle stage</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="SCENARIO">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Scenario</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Scénario</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Scenario</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="DECIMALS">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Decimals</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Décimales</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Decimals</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
      </structure:ConceptScheme>
    </structure:Concepts>
    <structure:DataStructures>
      <structure:DataStructure id="DSD_GHG_PLC_P" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" version="1.0" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Global Plastic Outlook - Projections of Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Plastic Lifecycle</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Perspectives mondiales des plastiques - Projections des emissions de gaz à effet de serre de l’ensemble du cycle de vie des plastiques</common:Name>
        <structure:DataStructureComponents>
          <structure:DimensionList id="DimensionDescriptor">
            <structure:Dimension id="MEASURE" position="1">
              <structure:ConceptIdentity>
                <Ref id="MEASURE" maintainableParentID="CS_GPO" maintainableParentVersion="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="conceptscheme" class="Concept" />
              </structure:ConceptIdentity>
              <structure:LocalRepresentation>
                <structure:Enumeration>
                  <Ref id="CL_MEASURE" version="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="codelist" class="Codelist" />
                </structure:Enumeration>
              </structure:LocalRepresentation>
            </structure:Dimension>
            <structure:Dimension id="POLLUTANT" position="2">
              <structure:ConceptIdentity>
                <Ref id="POLLUTANT" maintainableParentID="CS_GPO" maintainableParentVersion="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="conceptscheme" class="Concept" />
              </structure:ConceptIdentity>
              <structure:LocalRepresentation>
                <structure:Enumeration>
                  <Ref id="CL_POLLUTANT" version="1.1" agencyID="OECD" package="codelist" class="Codelist" />
                </structure:Enumeration>
              </structure:LocalRepresentation>
            </structure:Dimension>
            <structure:Dimension id="PLASTIC_LIFEC_S" position="3">
              <structure:ConceptIdentity>
                <Ref id="PLASTIC_LIFEC_S" maintainableParentID="CS_GPO" maintainableParentVersion="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="conceptscheme" class="Concept" />
              </structure:ConceptIdentity>
              <structure:LocalRepresentation>
                <structure:Enumeration>
                  <Ref id="CL_PLASTIC_LIFEC_S" version="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="codelist" class="Codelist" />
                </structure:Enumeration>
              </structure:LocalRepresentation>
            </structure:Dimension>
            <structure:Dimension id="FREQ" position="4">
              <structure:ConceptIdentity>
                <Ref id="FREQ" maintainableParentID="CS_GPO" maintainableParentVersion="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="conceptscheme" class="Concept" />
              </structure:ConceptIdentity>
              <structure:LocalRepresentation>
                <structure:Enumeration>
                  <Ref id="CL_FREQ" version="2.1" agencyID="SDMX" package="codelist" class="Codelist" />
                </structure:Enumeration>
              </structure:LocalRepresentation>
            </structure:Dimension>
            <structure:Dimension id="SCENARIO" position="5">
              <structure:ConceptIdentity>
                <Ref id="SCENARIO" maintainableParentID="CS_GPO" maintainableParentVersion="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="conceptscheme" class="Concept" />
              </structure:ConceptIdentity>
              <structure:LocalRepresentation>
                <structure:Enumeration>
                  <Ref id="CL_SCENARIO" version="1.0" agencyID="OECD.ENV.EEI" package="codelist" class="Codelist" />
                </structure:Enumeration>
              </structure:LocalRepresentation>
            </structure:Dimension>
